key_points: Two students were injured in a shooting at Heritage High School in Newport News, Virginia.
A 17-year-old boy and a 17-year-old girl were the victims of the shooting, with injuries to the face and leg, respectively.
A suspect, also a boy, was taken into custody in connection with the shooting.
The suspect and victims were believed to know each other according to Newport News Police Chief Steve Drew.
Two additional people were hospitalized due to injuries sustained in the chaos following the shooting.
The firearm was recovered at the scene, and the motive of the shooting is under investigation.
Classes at the high school resumed on September 8, marking the students' second full week of the school year.
Superintendent George Parker mentioned the school conducts random searches for guns.
Authorities, including the FBI and state troopers, searched the school building following the evacuation.
Virginia Governor Ralph Northam and Senator Mark Warner expressed concern and are in contact with first responders.
spokespersons: Steve Drew (Police Chief, Newport News Police Chief)
George Parker (Superintendent, Newport News Public Schools)
